title: Indian rapist killer to be executed after abusing and murdering a two-year-old girl he locked up
text:
An Indian man who murdered a two-year-old girl after raping her is to face the death penalty, the country's Supreme Court has ruled.

The killer, named only as Ravi, snatched the child and assaulted her for around five hours.

She later died following the violent attack in Jalna, Maharashtra, in March 2012.

The killer, named only as Ravi, snatched the child and assaulted her for around five hours (file photo)

The court found by a 2-1 majority judgment it was a case where 'trust has been betrayed and social values are impaired', Indian media reported.

The 'convict had no control over his carnal desires [and] surpassed all natural, social and legal limits just to satiate his sexual hunger,' the court heard.

'He ruthlessly finished a life which was yet to bloom.'

Two of the three justices said: 'The appellant instead of showing fatherly love, affection and protection to the child against the evils of the society, rather made her the victim of lust.'

'The unnatural sex with a two-year old toddler exhibits a dirty and perverted mind, showcasing a horrifying tale of brutality.

'The appellant meticulously executed his nefarious design by locking one door of his house from the outside and bolting the other one from the inside so as to deceive people into believing that nobody was inside.'

Two of the three justices at India's Supreme Court (pictured) said: 'The appellant instead of showing fatherly love, affection and protection to the child against the evils of the society, rather made her the victim of lust'

The majority judgment said: 'The appellant was thus in his full senses while he indulged in this senseless act.'

But one justice disagreed, saying the claimant's case had been based on circumstantial evidence.

The justice opined the death penalty is changed to life imprisonment with no opportunity for parole.

A missing person's case was opened after the toddler's father raised awareness in March 2012, the prosecution said.

Police found Ravi's doors locked, broke in to find the child lying unconscious nearby.

The toddler was rushed to hospital but doctors said she was dead.
